page.title: 10THE A.C.E. SCHEME
page.content: {In 1981 youth unemploymet had become a {national problem.Local employers {started the Action in Congleton for {Youth Employment}part of the government Youth Traning Scheme. Charles Mill in Townsend Road was converted for this.On the ground floor 75 boys in a year are trained in all aspects of the building trade.Nearly all these boys get jobs after the years training.It is for school leavers and includes an outdoor activities holiday in the Lake District.For experience the boys do jobs for charity.They reroofed Congleton Scout Hut.On the next floor are the offices where{they organise {both boys and girls to do community {work,helping in play groups,handicap {centres and with old people.}They have made a play area,path from Daven School to Grangeland Park.
